content: Crystallographic datacrystallographic data‡ Experimental data for 1: a mixture of Co(NO3)2·6H2O (145 mg, 0.5 mmol), 1,4-H2ndc (108 mg, 0.5 mmol), 1,3-bix (119 mg, 0.5 mmol), NaOH (10 mg, 0.25 mol), and water (12 mL) was placed in a 23 ml Teflon reactor and kept under autogenous pressure at 150 °C for three days. Then the mixture was cooled to room temperature, and pink crystals of 1 were obtained in a 46% yield based on Co(II). Elem. and ICP anal. for C76H57.5Ca0.2Co4N8O19: calcd (%): C 55.98, H 3.56, N 6.87, Ca 0.49. Found (%): C 55.72, H 3.46, N 6.79, Ca 0.44. ICP analyses for the 1,4-H2ndc and 1,3-bix gave the contents of Ca as 3.1‰ and 3.4‰, respectively.
clean_text:
Crystallographic data

crystallographic data

‡ Experimental data for 1: a mixture of Co(NO3)2⋅6H2O (145 mg, 0.5 mmol), 1,4-H2ndc (108 mg, 0.5 mmol), 1,3-bix (119 mg, 0.5 mmol), NaOH (10 mg, 0.25 mol), and water (12 mL) was placed in a 23 ml Teflon reactor and kept under autogenous pressure at 150 °C for three days. Then the mixture was cooled to room temperature, and pink crystals of 1 were obtained in a 46% yield based on Co(II). Elem. and ICP anal. for C76H57.5Ca0.2Co4N8O19: calcd (%): C 55.98, H 3.56, N 6.87, Ca 0.49. Found (%): C 55.72, H 3.46, N 6.79, Ca 0.44. ICP analyses for the 1,4-H2ndc and 1,3-bix gave the contents of Ca as 3.1‰ and 3.4‰, respectively.
